titleInfo.title: Miss Mary Hall interview: first teaching job

location.physicalLocation: Albert Gore Research Center, Middle Tennessee State University
Digital Initiatives, James E. Walker Library, Middle Tennessee State University

mods.abstract: Mary Hall discusses her first teaching job after World War I in a one-teacher school house. Hall had two years of college work prior to taking the job. She taught twenty-five students from first to eighth grade. One of her students was "Red" Owens, a football player at Middle Tennessee. Although Hall does not mention the name of the school in the interview, Rita Schaerer King provides the location of the school in her biography, Mary Hall: a 20th century pioneer for educational progress in Tennessee (Peabody College for Teachers of Vanderbilt University, 1993). This location matches the description of Porterfield School in Louise Houck Wiserâ€™s A History of Rutherford County Schools (Murfreesboro, Tenn.: Rutherford County Retired Teachers Association, 1986).
